[b][color=white]Reusable Emails for Inactive Accounts[/color][/b]
Previously, only one email address could be associated with and used to register an account. This has now been changed after a suggestion from a returning member, allowing the address from the previous account to be reused, so long as they were closed for inactivity and not as punishment. [i][size=x-small][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5276963]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white][u]Announcement Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color]No announcement threads were created this week.

[b][color=white][u]Informational Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5272698][b]HOW TO FALL ASLEEP IN 30 SECONDS[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3124454][color=#99FF00][b]ᴘʜƎx[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]User ᴘʜƎx made a thread teaching members how to fall asleep in just a matter of seconds. If you have troubles falling asleep, come check out this method!

[b][color=white][u]Entertaining Threads[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5278561][b]Most Famous Person You Know?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1927837][color=#99FF00][b]C Doubt[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Ever met a celebrity? Who's the most famous person you know? Post it here!

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5278516][b]Once you see it, you CAN'T UNSEE IT! INSANE[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2840151][color=#EFEFEF][b]Doodlegod[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Doodlegod recently shared with a lounge a very cool optical illusion.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5277008][b]How fast can you type?[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=3081715][color=#99FF00][b]Āidań N[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]How fast can you type? The member, Āidań N, is curious to know! Post your results in this thread.

[b][color=white][u]Contests and Giveaways[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5260432][b]Yes back again with another giveaway[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1960790][color=#EFEFEF][b]Errors[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]One of Eternal's group leaders, Errors, is currently hosting a never ending giveaway. For a chance to win some money or awards, check out this contest today.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5280079][b]Leet & Uber Only! RainSpider's Amazon Item Giveaway #1![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2022623][color=#00AAFF][b]RainSpider3000[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Everyone loves purchasing stuff off of Amazon. If you have something on your wishlist, enter for a chance to win just that!

[b][color=white][u]Member Feedback Threads[/u][/color][/b]

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5272630][b]My "feedback" thread. (AKA shoutout thread)[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1185212][color=black][b]Fiber[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Very short feedback thread created by the member Fiber.

[b][color=white][u]Miscellaneous[/u][/color][/b] 

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5269529][b]HFAlert 24/7 Radio | DJs | Song Requests | And more![/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2941702][color=#00AAFF][b]$tash[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Check out this brand new 24/7 radio station where you can freely request music, chat with others, and listen to some good tunes.

[color=#333333]---[/color][url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5273879][b]Bitcoin Transaction Time Calculator[/b][/url] - [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url]
[color=#333333]---[/color]Owner of Hack Forums, Omniscient, created a thread in the Crypto Currency forum bringing up an idea that would be perfect for a project. Interested in what that is? Come here to check it out!

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Interview.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473].Sinister[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[hr]

[color=#1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086]Roytoy[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Hey Roytoy! Welcome to the 292nd edition of the HF News! Do you have any shoutouts you want to make before we begin?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] Hey there, thanks for having me! I'd like to give a shoutout to AXiS, Krave, Regulus, Remix and Mr Kewl, and all my bros at Echo and The Order!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] If I'm correct, you were [url=http://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=4289677]interviewed[/url] by one of our past Writers two years ago. How has things changed over the course of those two years for you?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] It definitely seems a lot less than 2 years to me. One of the major things that happened is that my country blocked access to HF for some reason for more than a year. I was only able to access HF by using a VPN and it was super slow. Which explains why I was super inactive for the past year or so. However, fortunately for me they finally unblocked it around 3 months ago and I've been active again ever since. Really love to be back!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] A few members have mentioned to me that you have an addiction to gambling? Is that true?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] Haha, Is that what I'm famous for nowadays? I don't think I have an "addiction," or maybe I do but I still haven't gotten over the "admitting the problem" step? What I know is, that I've been gambling ever since 2013. I usually keep it to $10 a day. Sometimes I win, sometimes I lose. It's hard to quit because there are so many new websites and games to have fun with. When I lose, I try to convince myself I'm just "paying for fun" and "It's just like WoW or any other online game," but yeah, I would say I'm at a negative $1,500 if we count my overall gambling. Shoutout to my broke-ass back in 2009 when I didn't know how to make $1, let alone gamble $1,000!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Yikes. That's sure a lot of money you're dealing with. How has life changed for you over the past two years?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] Well, I'm now in my 4th year studying Architecture in Syria. When I did the last interview I was in my second year. I also started focusing a lot on my dream career, which is filmmaking. Once I finish with Architecture I plan to go to the US and study filmmaking. Not much has changed since then other than that. A lot of my friends fled the country (almost all of them,) this is why HF a blessing to me right now. I get to spend my time doing something I love, online.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Filmmaking is definitely an interesting career path. Is there any reason why you want to go into filmmaking?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] There are so many reasons, but the one reason I often find myself being reminded by is, when you watch a movie, and you get caught in the moment, where you're so emotionally involved into the character and how the character feels, you learn with it, you grow from it, you're a changed person, with different views, you see the world in a different perspective than you used to. You are no longer the person you were before you watched that movie. There are countless times where I found myself in tears or goosebumps because I can relate to a character so much that it felt like I was the character, not the one watching it. I want to become a filmmaker because I want to be able to give that feeling to others.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] They say the best job you can have is the one you love doing. How come you haven't fled the country yet like most of your other friends?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] That's what I believe in! I haven't left the country because I need to get my degree first. Honestly, I don't like architecture but I need it to study filmmaking. Without a degree I can't go to the US nor study what I love. I have a mission and hopefully I'll finish it in 1 year! plus, I can travel anywhere in the summer and get back when college starts.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Have you been to the U.S.? And if so where?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] I've actually never been to the US. I've been to many places before. Different places in Europe, but sadly never the US.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] If you were given the opportunity to come to the U.S., where would you go and why?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] I would probably go to Los Angeles, California. It's where all the filmmakers/production companies are. It's where the university that I'm planning to go to is in. I've also heard it has really nice weather and great people. I would also love to visit New York but it wouldn't make sense to stay there since it's pretty expensive.

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] NY is quite expensive, and LA is filled with filmmakers/production companies. LA is a good choice in my opinion. Besides HF, what else do you do in your freetime?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] I really try to work on my filmmaking skills as much as I can. There aren't any filmmaking schools in my city, nor are there any big filmmakers or mentors that can help me, but much like everything else, I try to consume as much knowledge as I can from the internet. Sites like Youtube have had a huge impact on me. I would definitely be a different person in a different life without them. I also work with a non-profit organization called Mobaderoon, and I handle all their video stuff. Other than that I'm just constantly trying to find balance between college and my filmmaking career!

[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2214473][color=#D63030][b].Sinister:[/b][/color][/url] Keep that up and you might just end up being one of the best filmmakers soon. 
That's all we have for today. Is there anything else you want to say before we wrap this up?
[url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=130086][color=white][b]Roytoy:[/b][/color][/url] I wont stop till I am! and I just wanted to thank you for the time you've given me and invested in this interview, and shoutout to the news team for being amazing. When I wasn't able to come on HF due to my country blocking it, I made sure I read every single HF news report to stay updated. HF News is a HUGE THING, and what you guys do for this community is beyond outstanding!

[/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]
posts.subject: Hack Forums News // Edition 292

posts.message:
[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]
[align=center][size=large][b][color=white]Support HF News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e360b3]Memo[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#7fcdaf]World News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#bbed22]Science News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#6b80ff]Tech News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#50c072]Gaming News[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#785eda]Hacking News[/color][/b][/size][/align]
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v2/SupportHFN.png[/img][/align]

[align=center]We publish the HF News every week yet we have aged members who don't even know we exist! Wear any of the signatures listed below to support us and spread the word about HF News, HF Wiki, and Writers altogether.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Memo.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239]iHydra[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[b][color=white]Science News is Live! So What's Next?[/color][/b]
Hope our new section will be of interest to the majority of our readers. We'd love to have some feedback on the new sections we've introduced however we aren't done just yet. One more planned section is in the works, Business News. No ETA on when it will go live but stay tuned for updates as we'll introduce it one week before it goes live.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/WorldNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=255459]Delirium™[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://news.sky.com/story/1698930/flight-ms804-what-do-we-know-so-far][b][color=white]EgyptAir Airbus A320 Crashes South of Greece[/color][/b][/url]
An Airbus A320 operated by EgyptAir was reported missing on May 20, with its last known location being south of Greece. Extensive search of the area concludes that the Airbus crashed, and that no survivors have yet to be found. Reports from investigators indicate that the cause of the crash is most likely due to an explosion caused by a bomb planted on the airplane, or a terrorist attack. Panos Kammenos, the Greek defense minister, ruled out the possibility of mechanical failure as a cause. Kammenos' statement has been confirmed by the Egyptian Civil Aviation minister, Sherif Fathy. Flight MS804 departed from Paris and was en route to Cairo before going missing. The plane was carrying 56 passengers and a crew of 10 people.

[url=http://abcnews.go.com/US/marine-veteran-charlie-linville-combat-wounded-amputee-scale/story?id=39243648][b][color=white]First Amputee Wounded in Combat to Scale Mount Everest[/color][/b][/url]
A man wounded during an explosion in Afghanistan has become the first wounded-in-combat amputee to climb mount Everest. Sergeant Charlie Linville, a 30-year-old and father of two, climbed the eight-kilometer-high mountain with a prosthetic leg on May 20, 2016. According to The Heroes Project, an organization that leads expeditions consisting of veterans who have been wounded in action, Sgt. Linville decided to have his leg amputated after a series of fruitless surgeries to have it restored. The third attempt to climb Mount Everest proved to be successful after their previous two expeditions were cancelled and postponed: one to honor the 18 Sherpas who found tragic death during an avalanche, and the other due to the Nepal earthquake of 2015.

[url=http://metro.co.uk/2016/05/19/a-bunch-of-chefs-in-italy-just-made-a-pizza-thats-over-a-mile-long-5892045/][b][color=white]A Mile Long Pizza Breaks World Record[/color][/b][/url]
A team of over 400 chefs has gathered in Naples, Italy, with one purpose in mind; to make the longest pizza the world has ever seen. After gathering
all the ingredients needed, which consisted of 2 tones of flour and mozzarella respectively, 1,6 tones of tomatoes and 200 liters of water, they managed
to pull the feat off and break the world record of the longest pizza ever made. The end result? A pizza with the incredible length of 1,853 meters and a great taste, since
it was baked on a wood over of the same length!

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://hackforums.news/assets/v2/ScienceNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Intelligent Sin[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.eurekalert.org/pub_releases/2016-05/epfd-tso051716.php][b][color=white]Your City's Layout Determines the Weather you Experience[/color][/b][/url]
To this day, heat is (still) one of the most common byproducts of electrical sources produced in large cities around the world; in turn, the heat produced is stored in any and all concrete in the vicinity. Later, when the sun goes down, the heat stored within the concrete is released back into its surroundings. This heat is relative to the size and shape of the city you live in. Furthermore, with current technology, our methods of determining weather patterns fail to account for the exact size, shape, and features of said cities, and that leads to less accurate weather predictions. Marco Giometto, a leading author of the study, states, "Most city representations used in weather models are based on data obtained from tower measurements made at a particular location within the city, which current models approximate as a rough patch of land. The transport of heat, humidity, or pollutants is then computed using mathematical relationships. These relationships implicitly assume that the city is geometrically regular, which is a stringent assumption."

[url=https://www.sciencedaily.com/videos/570c0bbb908ac51cc327c62d10b08196.htm][b][color=white]Hottest April Ever Recorded[/color][/b][/url]
New data gathered from NASA shows that this past April was the hottest ever recorded! The previous record for the hottest April was obtained back in 2010, and this past April was a whole 0.24 degrees Celsius hotter. While some climate scientists remain optimistic, others argue that this number is higher than expect, and something that cannot be ignored. It's speculated by some specialists that with new data surfacing, we could see a repeat of such large dividends for all 12 months!  

[url=http://medicalxpress.com/news/2016-05-key-protein-stifles-cancer-mice.html][b][color=white]Control of a Key Protein in Mice Suspends Growth of Cancer[/color][/b][/url]
In order for cancer to survive in its host, it has to find suitable tissue within the body.  Along with looking for tissue, cancer cells simultaneously prepare tissue to perpetuate its growth; In this particular case, by diverting a protein that weakens defenses the body would normally take care of. Dr. Jack A. Elias says, "Cancers are known to have the ability to co-opt or evade host anti-tumor response." According to Elias, seizing back control of that protein allows them to bring back a number of defenses in the lungs that would suspend cancer growth almost entirely. Later, Elias and his fellow researchers went on to figure out that a key protein identified as Chitinase 3-like-1 (CHI3L1) plays a big part in advancing cancer growth in otherwise healthy cells. By standing in the way of the path CHI3L1 produces they managed to gain back control of previously compromised defenses and block the spread of cancer to the lungs.

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/TechNews.png[/img][b][i]
By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1730460]Gladly[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.informationweek.com/it-life/google-hiring-driverless-car-testers-in-arizona/d/d-id/1325526 ][b]Google Hiring Test Pilots for Self-Driving Cars [/b][/url]
Do you live in Phoenix Arizona and have a valid driver’s license? Are you looking to make $20 an hour by sitting in an automated car? If so, then you’re the kind of person Google is looking for to test their self-driving cars. Those hired by Google for the “vehicle safety specialist” position, will sit in the driver’s seat of the self-driving Lexus SUV from around six to eight hours in a day, five days per week, and collect data about the car and its driving habits, as well as everything occurring during the ride. Along with having a clean driving record and a license, Google says those who are interested must have a bachelor’s degree, which can be in any field, and a clean background check. 

[url=http://www.csoonline.com/article/3070420/security/pornhub-said-to-be-compromised-shell-access-available-for-1-000][b]Pornhub Not Actually Compromised, Shell Access Seller Didn’t Have Access [/b][/url]
After a Twitter account going by the alias 1x0123 claimed they had shell access to adult entertainment supergiant Pornhub’s site, a spokesperson for the website has said that the claim was in fact not true. When the site’s team spoke with 1x0123 (who goes by “Revolver”), the claimant described a method that was not possible. Revolver told them that the technique used was uploading PHP code in an image file, but the site’s team has said that this was not possible because the servers were not configured to execute PHP code. The Twitter used was attempting to sell shell access for $1,000 USD, which is extremely low for a website of Pornhub’s stature, if true.

[url=http://www.snapmunk.com/airbar-makes-screen-touchscreen/][b]AirBar Makes any Laptop Screen a Touch Screen [/b][/url]
With just a magnetic bar and a USB cable, the AirBar by Neonode will turn any laptop running Windows 8, Windows 10, or even Chromebooks – into a touch-screen laptop. The bar works by making an invisible light beam pass throughout the front of your screen, registering your touches onto your screen. The twist with the AirBar is that aside from working with your fingers, it will also work with a variety of objects, including brushes and gloves. The device hasn’t been made available for purchase yet, although it is available for pre-order for $69 and will supposedly ship in the first half of 2016.

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/fallout-4-xbox-one-mods-beta-test-invites-sent-out/1100-6440078/][b][color=white]Fallout 4 Xbox One Mods Beta Test Invites Sent Out[/color][/b][/url]
In-game modifications have always been popular among the gaming community. Whether it be the use of a modded console such as a JTAG or using certain programs on the computer, at least every game nowadays have an exploit or mod that can be done. Fans of Bethesda's game, Fallout 4, will soon have the chance to use mods similar to the ones that computer gamers have access to on the PC version. On May 10 Bethesda had tweeted out that they are looking for players to beta test their new mod update. The players that had the chance of signing up and were accepted into the beta testing program should have received an email on May 23. Whether Bethesda will be sending out the invites as a wave to a group of people overtime, or keep it small and limited is unknown. This is something the game company has not done before, especially for console gamers. Some mods that are being included are: Brings The Notorious B.I.G. alive including his music to the game, Star Wars lightsabers, and even Thomas the Tank Engine is introduced as an enemy. This beta program will be open to Playstation 4 players sometime in June. The official release date for when the mods will be publicly available are still unknown at this time.

[url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/huge-overwatch-action-figures-are-showing-up-aroun/1100-6440022/][b][color=white]Huge Overwatch Action Figures Are Showing Up Around the World[/color][/b][/url]
Massive life sized figures of popular characters from Blizzard's latest game, Overwatch, have recently appeared in different parts of the world. As of now, there are currently only three life sized action figures out on display. First off, the damage dealing, duel wielding [url=http://i.imgur.com/ZczIwan.jpg]Tracer[/url] has been confirmed to be in Hollywood, California. Secondly, other reports show that the sly ninja, [url=http://i.imgur.com/QcdjSUq.jpg]Genji[/url], is located all the way in Paris. Lastly, fans from reddit have reported that the Samus-type character (Metroid), lookalike, [url=http://i.imgur.com/o873EYw.jpg]Pharah[/url], has been put on display in Busan, South Korea. The intent of these figures are still unknown to the public. Blizzard has recently created medium box loot crates that have been given out to popular YouTubers in the gaming community. Bluejacket, profoundly known as a media enthusiast the president of CSUF eSports was lucky enough to witness the display opening of the Tracer figure. In his tweets, Bluejacket shares with the public that the box describes all of Tracer's in-game abilities, showcases her two weapons, and even has a button you can click that says "try me"! The game will launch on May 24 and will be available for PC, Xbox One, and Playstation 4.

[url=http://www.techradar.com/us/news/gaming/a-look-inside-razer-s-first-us-store-a-playground-for-gamers-1321855][b][color=white]A Look Inside Razer's First US Store[/color][/b][/url]
The popular company best known for their gaming hardware, software and systems, Razer, has officially opened up their very first store in the United States. Currently located in downtown San Francisco, the new Razer Gaming store will act as a virtual little playground where gamers can come together and test out the products before purchasing. Everything is out for testing from keyboards to headsets all the way to Razer gaming computers. The store in San Francisco plans on holding gaming tournaments and bringing in a community of gamers to relax, hang out, and have fun! In addition to little events, the store plans on bringing professional gamers from different games featured in eSports to sign autographs and meet their fans. Laptops and desktops out for testing are pre-loaded with games that customers can play. There is no limit on how long you can stay in the store. Customers are allowed to sign into their accounts too. There won't be anyone hounding you and there aren't any restrictions as of yet on the computers so play away! The new Razer store can be described as something similar to Apple and Microsoft stores that are sometimes found in malls. An important notice about the store is that it doesn't compare to Apple and Microsoft stores. They sell themselves differently. No pun intended. The stock of products in the Razer stores are low, which promotes the activity of buying products online rather than in the store. Razer says they do not care about the money, but care that you are enjoying yourself in the store. Razer recommends you come in, try the products out, and if you're satisfied go home and order it online.

[color=transparent]     [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/HackingNews.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1422600]Fox™[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[url=http://www.ehackingnews.com/2016/05/teslacrypt-releases-master-key-as-it.html][b][color=white]TeslaCrypt Releases Master Key as it Shuts Down[/color][/b][/url]
TeslaCrypt has shut down, and researchers of ransomware have created a tool to decrypt files encrypted by the recent versions of the software. Analysts at ESET have noted that developers of TeslaCrypt have closed their doors, and distributors of TeslaCrypt have returned to distributing CryptXXX. TeslaCrypt came out in 2015, as a malicious program that would encrypt files, and throw up a landing page requiring a ransom for the user's files to be decrypted--usually via Bitcoin. When an ESET researcher went to the Tesla payment page, he asked over support chat if they would release the TeslaCrypt master key. To his surprise, they agreed to. The page is now closed and displays an apology for their actions, "Project closed, master key for decrypt XXX…XXX, we are sorry."

[url=http://www.hackersnewsbulletin.com/2016/05/talktalk-loses-half-profits-cyber-attack.html][b][color=white]TalkTalk Loses Half its Profits After Hack[/color][/b][/url]
After a hack in October of last year, TalkTalk's profits dropped from £32m last year to £14m this year, much of which was attributed to the £42m the company had to spend to recover. In an interview, TalkTalk CEO, Dido Harding, stated: “We have decided to invest more in the security of our company. This is something we now pay close attention to.” After a breach that allowed attackers to leak 160,000 users personal data, and caused TalkTalk to lose over 101,000 users. The attackers were able to access email accounts, names, phone numbers, and 21,000 different bank accounts. Six people were arrested in the UK following this attack, all under 21 years of age. Harding promised a strong comeback in the previous quarter, and says, “Our subscribers have come back and this the result of our honesty and openness in dealing with the cyber attack.”

[url=http://thehackernews.com/2016/05/hack-instagram-account.html][b][color=white]Bug Hunter Found Ways into any Instagram Account[/color][/b][/url]
Belgian bounty hunter Arne Swinnen found two vulnerabilities within Instagram, allowing him to brute-force and get into a user's account with little effort. Both methods of exploitation were possible because of Instagram's weak password policies and incremental user ID's. Swinnen found that he could brute-force into accounts using the Android authentication API, which had weak security policies implemented. The first 1,000 tries returned, "password you entered is incorrect," while the next 1,000 return, "username not found." Likely due to a rate-limit on the API. The second exploit was through Instagram's registration page on their website. An attacker could easily start a brute-force attack using that form without even setting off an account lock. After making a test account, and then replaying the registration request, Instagram responded with, "Those credentials belong to an active Instagram account." Swinnen was able to force over 10,000 requests on the page because there was no rate-limit.

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[font=Trebuchet MS][size=1][color=transparent]       [/color]
[align=center][size=large][b][color=#89dce1]Spotlight[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e15555]Trends[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=#e0d858]Comics[/color] [color=white]•[/color] [color=white]HF News Team[/color][/b][/size][/align]
[color=transparent]       [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Spotlight.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=561239]iHydra[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[align=center][size=x-large][color=white][font=Monotype Corsiva][i]"Lost In Space"[/i][/font][/color][/size]
[img]http://i.imgur.com/flR0Ocb.png[/img]
by [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2234857][color=#99ff00]Jorthmo[/color][/url][/align]

[align=center]Do you deserve a spot on here? PM iHydra with a good reason and let's get you on the spotlight![/align]

[color=transparent]         [/color]

[align=center][img]http://www.hackforums.news/assets/v2/Trends.png[/img][/align]
[align=center][b][i]By [url=http://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=692131]Ariana[/url][/i][/b][/align]

[align=center][spoiler=GHOSTBUSTERS - Official Trailer #2 (2016)][video=youtube]https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gMfUjDnpfRY[/video][/spoiler][/align]

[url=http://pitchfork.com/news/65513-the-underachievers-release-new-mixtape-it-happened-in-flatbush-listen/][b][color=white]The Underachievers Release New Mixtape It Happened in Flatbush[/color][/b][/url]
The hip-hop duo from Brooklyn, New York have recently released their latest mixtape, "It Happened in Flatbush" on May 15, 2016. With help from upcoming underground music producers such as Ronny J, The Underachievers provide their latest mixtape with trap heavy beats and insightful lyrics. The mixtape cover, which can be seen [url=http://i.imgur.com/q9oOa8J.jpg]here[/url], displays the artists, AK (left) and Issa Gold (right), wearing what seems to be Brooklyn Dodgers uniforms. It Happened in Flatbush is the sequel to their Lords of Flatbush mixtape which was released in August of 2013. AK and Issa aren't much into promoting their work as some artists might. Instead, the two randomly dropped songs at different times to tease their fans. To celebrate April 20, (4/20) the duo uploaded a track on popular music streaming service, SoundCloud, titled "Play That Way" which received very positive feedback. A month later in May, The Underachievers uploaded "Really Got It" on Mother's Day 2016, hyping fans up for the soon to come album to be released. Some may the artists are past due with new music since the release of their last EP, Evermore: The Art of Duality back in Sep. 2015. The hip-hop duo made a strong comeback with It Happened in Flatbush. Finishing strong, the duo plan to hit the road as they participate in The Smoker's Club tour. The tour features artists such as Cam’ron, G-Herbo, Smoke DZA, Mobsquad Nard and Nyck Caution. To see when they are coming to a town near you, check out this link [url=http://i.imgur.com/bvtHh5l.png]here[/url]!

[url=http://www.rollingstone.com/music/news/ariana-grande-releases-dangerous-woman-album-20160519][b][color=white]Ariana Grande Releases Third Album[/color][/b][/url]
The 22-year-old, donut-licking, pop diva Ariana Grande has recently released her third studio album titled Dangerous Woman. With tracks featuring well known artists such as Lil Wayne, Future, and collabing with her 'Bang Bang' big sister Nicki Minaj, Ariana flaunts off her sexual side. The little girl you once knew from her previous album, My Everything, is completely gone. With  multiple different album covers of her in latex clothing as well as provocative photoshoots, the diva classifies herself as a Dangerous Woman not to be reckoned with. The cover photo that was officially chosen showcases the 22-year-old wearing a latex bunny mask. She states, "I feel like DW is a heightened super version of myself, so I wanted her to have a costume. The shot caller/boss." The album which contains 15 songs includes the four singles which were released titled, "Dangerous Woman", "Into You", "Be Alright", and "Let Me Love You". For those who purchased the hard copy album from Target you will receive two extra songs. If you purchased the pre-ordered bundle from Ariana Grande's official website, a signed post card will be included in your purchase once shipped. Teasing her fans all over social media services such as, Twitter, Snapchat, and Instagram, including some little inside jokes only her fans which are called "Arianators" knew about. Things such as, "Spilling the Moonlight tea", and "Sweet like candy", which later on was discovered to be lyrics from some of her songs in the album. With help from late night TV show host Jimmy Fallon, the radio station concert Wango Tango hosted by KissFM, and Saturday Night Live, the popstar was able to perform the popular mainstream singles people all across the globe liked. As this time there is no information on whether there will be a tour or not, but Ariana has stated more details will be released in the future.

[url=http://noisey.vice.com/blog/birdman-breakfast-club-interview-curse-out][b][color=white]Put Some Respek on My Name![/color][/b][/url]
Morning radio show "The Breakfast Club" on New York's Power 105.1 radio station contains different segments where the three hosts: Angela Yee, DJ Envy and Charlamagne Tha God discuss hip-hop and celebrity news. On their most recent podcast, the three invited American rapper, Bryan Williams, known by his stage name Birdman onto the show. Straight off the bat, the American entered very hostile like and enraged. All three hosts were surprised to see this type of attitude, but continued to go along with it. Charlamagne Tha God was specifically called out at this point in time by the American rapper. Birdman looked Charlamagne in the face and told him how he felt about the show disrespecting him in the past. After two minutes into the what was not even really an interview, Birdman got up and walked out. You could tell from the voice of Birdman that the rapper was not playing around. Constantly repeating the phrase, "Put some respek on my name". The artists didn't really threaten or harass Charlamagne, but listening very closely one can discover a few hints here and there.

[url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/kanye-pulled-a-kanye-and-got-way-too-philosophical-on-ellen_us_573e06dce4b0aee7b8e95897][b][color=white]Kanye West Keeps it Real on Ellen[/color][/b][/url]
On May 19, hip-hop artist Kanye West had the opportunity to be a special guest on the popular comedy talk-show The Ellen DeGeneres Show. The first few questions toward the artist were more focused on the Tweets that Kanye West has posted in the past. Things from Kim K not wanting to have any more kids, crazy and random things such as wanting Mark Zuckerberg to pay him $53,000 and other funny stuff! In this eight minute interview, Kanye opened up a part of him that many people may have not seen before. Ellen was able to get some thought provoking and philosophical responses from the hip-hop artist. Very cheerful and vibrant, the artist had a smile on his face during most of the interview. He took it very seriously, which some might find to be a surprise after announcing his presidential bid speech during the VMA's. Kanye for president 2020! Digging deep into his mind, the artist goes off saying, "F**k the paparazzi". Kanye understands everyone may not like him, but after that he includes a message saying that all the things he does and says is the truth. Sprinkling some more goodness on the scoop Kanye just grabbed for us, the rapper also states, "Isn’t that so funny? That people point fingers at the people who have influenced us the most?" After listening to this interview Mr. West possibly left some people with mind-boggling thoughts.
